fr.upmc.datacenter.hardware.computers.interfaces

Interface ComputerDynamicStateDataI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.upmc.components.interfaces.ComponentImplementedI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataOfferedI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataRequiredI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.OfferedI, java.rmi.Remote, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.RequiredI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ComputerDynamicStateDataConnector, ComputerDynamicStateDataInboundPort, ComputerDynamicStateDataOutboundPort

    public interface ComputerDynamicStateDataI
extends fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataOfferedI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataRequiredI
    The interface ComputerDynamicStateDataI defines the dynamic state notification services for Computer components.

    Description

    The interface extends the standard DataOfferedI and DataRequiredI with their methods to pull and push data. It adds methods to start and stop pushing of data in the server to be used by the client to manage its notification reception periods.

    Invariant

     invariant      true

    Created on : 28 janv. 2015

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      void startLimitedPushing(int interval, int n)
      start n>/code> pushing of computer dynamic state information and force the pushing to be done each interval period of time.

    • Method Detail

      • startUnlimitedPushing

        void startUnlimitedPushing(int interval)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        start the pushing of computer dynamic state information and force the pushing to be done each interval period of time.

        Contract

         pre    interval > 0
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        interval - delay between pushes (in milliseconds).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • startLimitedPushing

        void startLimitedPushing(int interval,
                       int n)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        start n>/code> pushing of computer dynamic state information and force the pushing to be done each interval period of time.

        Contract

         pre    interval > 0 && n > 0
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        interval - delay between pushes (in milliseconds).
        n - total number of pushes to be done, unless stopped.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
